snippet: Although a grand jury decided not to indict a police officer who shot a 68-year-old man in his apartment, federal prosecutors will see if the victim’s rights were violated.
abstract: Federal prosecutors will begin review of whether civil rights laws were violated in case of Kenneth Chamberlain Sr, who was shot to death in 2011 by Police Officer Anthony Carelli in his White Plains, NY, apartment; police, responding to a call for medical help that Chamberlain had unknowingly triggered, contend that he met their attempts to enter his home with violent resistance.
lead_paragraph: Although a grand jury decided not to indict a police officer who shot a 68-year-old man in his apartment, federal prosecutors will see if the victim’s rights were violated.

headline.seo: U.S. to Review if White Plains Man’s Civil Rights Were Violated
headline.main: Case of Man Killed by Police to Get Civil Rights Review
headline.print_headline: Case of Man Killed by Police Is to Get Civil Rights Review
